title: Album Page, "Sketches of Pilaster and Architectural Details, Possibly from a Fireplace at Château de Blois, France", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, lower left: modillion; to right: this modillion rests on top of pilaster / gold ... cut out of wood to depth of about .001. . . / bottom center edge of sheet: Base of / Pilaster. Verso, in graphite, center: Chimney at Blois Chateau; upper right corner: 104.
dimensions: Sheet: 20 x 31.1 cm (7 7/8 x 12 1/4 in.), irregular
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding and oriented so that the right edge of sheet is the top of the drawing space.  At left is a view in plan and elevation of a modillion with leaf and rosette elements.  To the right of this, and perpendicular to the drawing at left, is an elevation of the lower section of a group of pilasters with details of their dimensions and color indicated.  Below this, and again perpendicular to the first drawing at the left side of the sheet, is a plan, possibly of a group of pilasters like those in the second drawing previously described.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketches of Pilaster and Architectural Details, Possibly from a Fireplace at Château de Blois, France", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-269.
